proxy.description: The proxy is not active. Click the button below to activate it.
proxy.inactive: Activate the proxy to see blocked requests

autoStartSwitch.description: Start Zen automatically when you log in
autoStartSwitch.label: Autostart

createFilterList.ifHijacked: if hijacked by a malicious party.
createFilterList.onlyEnable: Only enable this option for lists from sources you trust.
createFilterList.trustedCapabilities: Trusted lists can use powerful blocking capabilities, such as

ignoredHostsInput.description: Hosts to exclude from proxying. Use this for services with certificate pinning or those disrupted by proxying.
ignoredHostsInput.label: Ignored Hosts

portInput.description: The port the proxy server will listen on (0 for random).
portInput.helper: Using a port below 1024 may require elevated privileges.
portInput.label: Port

requestLog.emptyState: Start browsing to see blocked requests.

about.tagline: Your Comprehensive Ad-Blocker and Privacy Guard

ca.confirmTitle: Are you sure you want to uninstall the CA?

reasons.malfunctioning: You suspect that your CA installation is malfunctioning. This issue may manifest as a browser error when visiting HTTPS websites, or as other applications being unable to connect to the internet.
reasons.uninstall: You want to uninstall Zen completely.

ca.reinstallInfo: If you start Zen again, a new CA will be installed.
ca.stopProxyTooltip: Stop the proxy to uninstall the CA

updates.description: If "Automatic updates" is selected, the app will automatically check for and apply updates on launch.
updates.title: Updates

startStopButton.gnomeNote: System proxy configuration is currently only supported on GNOME.
startStopButton.perAppBasis: to set the proxy on a per-app basis.
